title: Can Lula save the Amazon?
description: Deforestation in Brazil is threatening the future of the world's biggest rainforest.

title: Thousands join Israeli judicial protests amid soaring tensions
description: Tens of thousands of people once again join protests in Tel Aviv against the government's proposed judicial overhaul.

title: Saudi foreign ministry says delegation arrives in Iran
description: A Saudi 'technical delegation' meets Iran's chief of protocol at the foreign ministry in Tehran, Riyadh says.

title: Ukraine children returned from Russia after alleged deportation
description: Dozens of children reunited with families in Ukraine after being deported to Russia from occupied areas, charity says.

title: Armed groups kill dozens in Nigeria’s Benue state
description: At least 74 people killed in two separate attacks by armed groups this week, officials say.

title: Iran to use cameras in public spaces to identify unveiled women
description: The police says it will 'not tolerate any kind of individual or collective behaviour and action' violating the law.

title: Chad to expel German ambassador over ‘discourteous attitude’
description: Gov't orders Gordon Kricke to leave country within 48 hours for 'non-respect of diplomatic customs', ministry says.

title: At least 20 missing after boat sinks off Tunisia
description: The coastguard rescued 17 others, two of whom are in critical condition, says Sfax court judge Faouzi Masmousdi.

title: Hundreds of Russians attend war-blogger Vladlen Tatarsky funeral
description: Popular pro-war blogger was Russian killed by a bomb blast in a busy cafe last Sunday.

title: Israel is creating an explosive situation in Al-Aqsa
description: Israeli efforts to change the status quo at religious sites in Jerusalem could trigger a regional conflict.

title: Analysis: Will Azerbaijan-Iran tensions lead to war?
description: Tehran has warned it cannot ignore what it considers a security threat emanating from growing Azerbaijan-Israel ties.

title: Lula at 100 days: President stalls in quest to reshape Brazil
description: Despite some gains in social welfare and Indigenous rights, analysts say progress is not happening fast enough.

title: Ten killed in Kenya as truck crashes into pedestrians
description: Police say crash in the town of Migori happened along a major highway when the driver lost control of the vehicle.

title: Car owner sues Tesla over alleged intrusion of privacy
description: Lawsuit filed after reports alleged Tesla employees privately shared videos and images recorded by vehicle cameras.

title: Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy to direct one of three new Star Wars films
description: Pakistan-born Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy will be the first woman and person of colour to direct a Star Wars movie.

title: Canada repatriates 14 citizens from ISIL camps in Syria
description: It is the fourth repatriation operation conducted by the Canadian government of its nationals held in detention camps.

title: Will the OPEC+ oil output cut make inflation worse?
description: In a surprise move, OPEC+ slashes oil production by 1.6 million barrels a day starting in May.

title: Csaba Korosi: Can the UN be led by those urging peace, not war?
description: The United Nations General Assembly president discusses whether reform is required for the UN to make progress.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 409
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 409th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: China begins three days of military drills in Taiwan Strait
description: PLA announces exercises amid Chinese anger over meeting between Taiwan's President and US House Speaker.

title: After a night of air raids, Palestinians in Gaza fear escalation
description: The Gaza Strip endured a night of bombardment as Israeli fighter jets conducted raids on several sites in the territory.

title: N Korea says tested another underwater nuclear attack ‘drone’
description: Second underwater drone test comes as Pyongyang continues efforts to expand and modernise its weaponry.
